This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=CLINICALANDFORENSICSIG.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-24T13:22:35Z Chris Mussell 2015-02-24T13:22:31+00:00 2015-02-24T13:22:31+00:00 19th March LBMSDG Agenda https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLINICALANDFORENSICSIG;f09c0d9e.1502 Dear Clinical & Forensic BMSS SIG Email List Subscriber,<br><br>Please find attached an agenda for the London Biological Mass Spectrometry Discussion Group Meeting to be held on Thursday the 19th March at the John Hanbury Lecture Theatre, UCL School of Pharmacy, 29-39 Brunswick square, London.<br><br>The below link will take you to a map and directions for the venue: [...] Chris Mussell 2015-02-24T13:17:24+00:00 2015-02-24T13:17:24+00:00 LBMSDG RSC SSG Student Talk Prize https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLINICALANDFORENSICSIG;e05b5255.1502 Dear Clinical & Forensic BMSS SIG Email List Subscriber,<br><br>At the end of each year the London Biological Mass Spectrometry Discussion Group committee reviews the presentations from each of the meetings and awards a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMost Valued Talk\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd prize and a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBest Student Talk\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd prize.<br><br>The LBMSDG has recently connected with the Royal Society of Chemistry\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Separation Science Group and we are very pleased to announce that the best student talk will now also carry a \ufffd\ufffd400 prize! (In addition to the much coveted engraved tankard and the kudos associated with winning the award). John Dutton 2014-07-07T13:10:35+01:00 2014-07-07T13:10:35+01:00 Advances in Clinical Analysis 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLINICALANDFORENSICSIG;7e652581.1407 Please be aware of what looks like a totally absorbing day!<br><br>Advances in Clinical Analysis 2014, 19th September, 2014.<br><br>Organised by The Chromatographic Society and the Separation Science Group of the Analytical Division of the Royal Society of Chemistry.<br><br>Location<br>Robens Suite,<br>29th Floor, Guy's Hospital Tower,<br>St Thomas' Street, London, SE1 9RT<br><br>Meeting Outline<br>The meeting will focus on separation and complementary/alternative techniques along with case studies from the hospital and academic areas. The program has been designed to give attendees an update for both routine and problem solving in clinical analysis. The nearest tube is London Bridge.<br><br>A map can be found at their website http://www.ukchamberofshipping.com/contact-us/ [...] Chris Mussell 2014-04-23T19:52:11+01:00 2014-04-23T19:52:11+01:00 MSACL abstract deadline https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLINICALANDFORENSICSIG;90be7a9b.1404 Dear Clinical & Forensic SIG Email List Subscriber,<br><br>The highly successful Mass Spectrometry Applications to the Clinical Lab conference will be launching a European off-shoot this September in Salzburg.<br><br>More details can be found at:<br><br>https://www.msacl.org/index.php<br><br>The podium abstract deadline and Young Investigator Travel award is rapidly approaching (29 April). The poster abstract deadline is 2 July. [...] Nadia Chan 2014-04-08T11:01:54+01:00 2014-04-08T11:01:54+01:00 Clinical Trials course at LSHTM https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLINICALANDFORENSICSIG;e0f90f07.1404 Clinical Trials short course<br>(<br>http://www.lshtm.ac.uk/study/cpd/sct.html?utm_source=ct&utm_medium=jiscmail&utm_campaign=clinical%20trials)<br><br>Location: London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine, London WC1<br>Course dates: 16 - 20 June 2014<br>Course Fee: \ufffd\ufffd1,365. This covers participation in the course, course<br>materials (manuals), tea/coffee, and lunch each day. Register by 16 May<br>2014.<br><br>Course outline<br>This course provides attendees with a clear understanding of the<br>essentials of Randomised Clinical Trials (RCTs), particularly phase III<br>trials. Lectures and practical sessions cover the key issues to be<br>considered in design, conduct, analysis and reporting, with a focus on<br>major clinical trials which directly influence clinical practice. Topics<br>are addressed with [...]
